t: Come,*pn let’s shout joyfully to the Lord,*s shout*ln triumphantly to the rock of our salvation!
Let’s*ln enter his presence with thanksgiving; let’s*ln shout triumphantly to him in song.
For*pn the Lord*s is a great God, a*ln great King above all gods.
The*ln depths of the earth are in his hand, and*ln the mountain peaks are his.
The*ln sea is his; he made it. His*ln hands formed the dry land.
Come,*pn let’s worship and bow down; let’s*ln kneel before the Lord*s our Maker.
For*ln he is our God, and*ln we are the people of his pasture, the*ln sheep under his care. Today,*ln if you hear his voice:
Do*ln not harden your hearts as at Meribah, as*ln on that day at Massah in the wilderness
where*ln your ancestors tested me; they*ln tried me, though they had seen what I did.
For*ln forty years I was disgusted with that generation; I*ln said, “They are a people whose hearts go astray; they*ln do not know my ways.”
So*ln I swore in my anger, “They*ln will not enter my rest.”
